intro: Hieracium nigriceps, commonly known as black-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish in color. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive dark purple or black center, which gives it its common name. Hieracium nigriceps is often found in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
